channel.title: WarsawJS Blog
channel.description: Discover JavaScript tutorials, technical articles, and expert insights from the WarsawJS community. Topics include React, Node.js, TypeScript, and modern web development.

image.title: WarsawJS Blog
image.description: WarsawJS Community Blog - JavaScript Knowledge Hub

item.title: The David Budden Autopsy
item.description: Software is built on layers of trust, but trust collapses the moment syntax is mistaken for meaning. This essay examines a recent, very public failure where formal verification and AI produced a proof that was perfectly valid—and entirely empty. It is not a story about bad tools, but about good tools used without epistemic discipline. When green checkmarks replace understanding, correctness becomes theater, and mathematics quietly exits the stage.
item.author: Heapwolf
item.content:encoded:
Software is built on layers of trust, but trust collapses the moment syntax is mistaken for meaning. This essay examines a recent, very public failure where formal verification and AI produced a proof that was perfectly valid—and entirely empty. It is not a story about bad tools, but about good tools used without epistemic discipline. When green checkmarks replace understanding, correctness becomes theater, and mathematics quietly exits the stage.

Read the full article at: https://substack.com/inbox/post/182634432

item.title: The Strategic Art of Asking 'Dumb' Questions
item.description: Why the best developers aren't afraid to look foolish at tech conferences. Learn the difference between valuable curiosity and ego-driven Q&A spam.
item.author: Piotr Zientara
item.content:encoded:
Why the best developers aren't afraid to look foolish at tech conferences. Learn the difference between valuable curiosity and ego-driven Q&A spam.

Read the full article at: https://piotrzientara.pl/the-strategic-art-of-asking-dumb-questions/

item.title: Meaningful Tests: Human Hubris vs. AI
item.description: Yontan Kra explores the evolving relationship between human developers and AI in software testing. A thought-provoking analysis of how AI is changing our approach to writing meaningful tests, and what this means for the future of quality assurance in software development.
item.author: Yonatan Kra
item.content:encoded:
Yontan Kra explores the evolving relationship between human developers and AI in software testing. A thought-provoking analysis of how AI is changing our approach to writing meaningful tests, and what this means for the future of quality assurance in software development.

Read the full article at: https://yonatankra.com/meaningful-tests-human-hubris-vs-ai/

item.title: How do you serve APIs for humans when bots are everywhere?
item.description: Jakub Wołyko shares his battle with 39,200 bot requests per 24h. The challenge: API updates once daily, bots hit it every second. The journey through 4 iterations to find the right balance between protection and accessibility.
item.author: Jakub Wołynko
item.content:encoded:
Jakub Wołyko shares his battle with 39,200 bot requests per 24h. The challenge: API updates once daily, bots hit it every second. The journey through 4 iterations to find the right balance between protection and accessibility.

Read the full article at: https://jakubwolynko.eu/blog/202510-cloudflare-and-automation-challange/

item.title: Do AI Tools Equalize Programmer Skills or Amplify Existing Differences?
item.description: Piotr Zientara explores whether AI coding tools like ChatGPT and GitHub Copilot are equalizing the playing field among programmers or actually widening the gap between skill levels. This thought-provoking analysis examines how AI tools impact both novice and expert developers, and what this means for the future of programming.
item.author: Piotr Zientara
item.content:encoded:
Piotr Zientara explores whether AI coding tools like ChatGPT and GitHub Copilot are equalizing the playing field among programmers or actually widening the gap between skill levels. This thought-provoking analysis examines how AI tools impact both novice and expert developers, and what this means for the future of programming.

Read the full article at: https://www.xfaang.com/blog/Do-AI-Tools-Equalize-Programmer-Skills-or-Amplify-Existing-Differences/536WdujboMZO2qvEo53cg8

item.title: You're misunderstanding DDD in Angular (and Frontend)
item.description: Tomasz Ducin addresses common misconceptions about Domain-Driven Design (DDD) in Angular and frontend development. He explains why DDD is not just about code structure or tooling, but about understanding the business domain and applying DDD principles across the entire product, not just the frontend. Learn why DDD is a product-wide discipline and how to avoid the pitfalls of 'frontend-only DDD.'
item.author: Tomasz Ducin
item.content:encoded:
Tomasz Ducin addresses common misconceptions about Domain-Driven Design (DDD) in Angular and frontend development. He explains why DDD is not just about code structure or tooling, but about understanding the business domain and applying DDD principles across the entire product, not just the frontend. Learn why DDD is a product-wide discipline and how to avoid the pitfalls of 'frontend-only DDD.'

Read the full article at: https://www.angularspace.com/youre-misunderstanding-ddd-in-angular-and-frontend/

item.title: Et in Arcadia ego: AI in modeling (ft. Lalaland.ai)
item.description: AI-generated models are beginning to appear on magazine covers, in campaigns, lookbooks, and shows. This article explores the implications of AI in the modeling industry, with a focus on Lalaland.ai and the ethical questions raised by this technology...

item.title: Are You Training Your Models?
item.description: Many misunderstand AI model training, believing it's as simple as "teaching" with personal data. Learn a practical approach to working with LLMs that involves using commercial models, experimenting extensively, and understanding their generative, probabilistic nature...
item.author: K-algo
item.content:encoded:
Many misunderstand AI model training, believing it's as simple as "teaching" with personal data. Learn a practical approach to working with LLMs that involves using commercial models, experimenting extensively, and understanding their generative, probabilistic nature...

Read the full article at: https://algorytmy.substack.com/p/are-you-training-your-models

item.title: Legacy Code: How to Approach
item.description: Sławomir Grochowski shares strategies for handling legacy code projects, focusing on comprehensive review of user needs and system solutions. Learn how to effectively analyze documentation, gather information from people familiar with the system, and use data to identify unused functionalities and prioritize critical elements in your approach to legacy code.
item.author: Sławomir Grochowski
item.content:encoded:
Sławomir Grochowski shares strategies for handling legacy code projects, focusing on comprehensive review of user needs and system solutions. Learn how to effectively analyze documentation, gather information from people familiar with the system, and use data to identify unused functionalities and prioritize critical elements in your approach to legacy code.

Read the full article at: https://slawomir-grochowski.com/posts/05-legacy-code-how-to-approach.html
